subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Why Logos Exist: From Cattle Brands to Corporations
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Logos Exist: From Cattle Brands to Corporations.

hook.text: The word 'brand' comes from Old Norse 'brandr' ‚Äî to burn. Ranchers burned marks onto cattle.

buildup.text: Ancient potters stamped their work so buyers knew who made it. Quality needed a mark.

discovery.text: A logo is a visual shortcut: it compresses reputation, quality, and identity into one symbol.

twist.text: Humans process images 60,000 times faster than text. Logos exploit our visual brain.

climax.text: From 3,000-year-old potter marks to Nike's swoosh, the purpose is the same: trust at a glance.

punchline.text: A logo is a reputation you can see in a millisecond.
